title: Drug Abuse Screening Test-10 (DAST-10)
description: Brief 10-item assessment tool to measure, evaluate, and identify drug use problems, excluding alcohol and tobacco. Assesses drug use in the past 12 months.

parameters.name: used_drugs_other_than_medical
parameters.description: Have you used drugs other than those required for medical reasons?

parameters.name: abuse_prescription_drugs
parameters.description: Do you abuse more than one drug at a time?

parameters.name: always_able_to_stop
parameters.description: Are you always able to stop using drugs when you want to? (Reverse scored)

parameters.name: blackouts_flashbacks
parameters.description: Have you had 'blackouts' or 'flashbacks' as a result of drug use?

parameters.name: feel_bad_guilty
parameters.description: Do you ever feel bad or guilty about your drug use?

parameters.name: spouse_parents_complain
parameters.description: Does your spouse (or parents) ever complain about your involvement with drugs?

parameters.name: neglected_family_work
parameters.description: Have you neglected your family because of your use of drugs?

parameters.name: engaged_illegal_activities
parameters.description: Have you engaged in illegal activities in order to obtain drugs?

parameters.name: withdrawal_symptoms
parameters.description: Have you ever experienced withdrawal symptoms (felt sick) when you stopped taking drugs?

parameters.name: medical_problems
parameters.description: Have you had medical problems as a result of your drug use (e.g., memory loss, hepatitis, convulsions, bleeding, etc.)?

ranges.interpretation: No evidence of drug-related problems. Continue routine screening at appropriate intervals.
Low level drug problems that may require monitoring and re-assessment of drug use at a later date.
Moderate level drug problems that necessitate further investigation with additional tests or resources. Consider brief intervention.
Substantial drug problems that require intensive assessment and treatment. Referral to specialized addiction services recommended.
Severe drug problems that require intensive assessment and medical treatment. Immediate referral to specialized addiction treatment program is warranted.

references: Skinner HA. The drug abuse screening test. Addict Behav. 1982;7(4):363-71. doi: 10.1016/0306-4603(82)90006-8.
Yudko E, Lozhkina O, Fouts AA. A comprehensive review of the psychometric properties of the Drug Abuse Screening Test. J Subst Abuse Treat. 2007;32(2):189-98. doi: 10.1016/j.jsat.2006.08.002.
Cocco KM, Carey KB. Psychometric properties of the drug abuse screening test in psychiatric outpatients. Psychol Assess. 1998;10(4):408-14. doi: 10.1037/1040-3590.10.4.408.
formula: Sum of positive responses: Items 1,2,4-10 score 1 point for 'Yes' answers; Item 3 scores 1 point for 'No' answer (reverse scored). Total possible score: 0-10 points.
notes: The DAST-10 assesses drug use problems in the past 12 months, excluding alcohol and tobacco.
Item 3 ('Are you always able to stop using drugs when you want to?') is reverse scored - 'No' = 1 point.
A score of â‰¥3 is generally considered indicative of problematic substance use.
The optimal cutoff score is 7 for diagnostic purposes, though 3 is often used for screening.
Clinical judgment should be used to interpret scores in light of demographic and contextual factors.
While self-administered, clinician presence is recommended to clarify questions and encourage honest responses.
